channel.title: How do i make the server says something?
channel.description: I want to make the server say something every so often is this possible?

item.title: How do i make the server says something?
item.dc:creator: @m.dog311 m.dog311
item.description:
@m.dog311 wrote:

X Screech X:

100 errors when compiling.[br][br][size=1]Posted on: August 30, 2008, 12:38:34 pm[/size][hr]Can I just make a notepad file and put it in there and safe it as *.java? Is that possible?

The 100 errors is because u messed up a bracket. And no you can’t just post that into a new txt file and make it a java. It won’t be set as a class.

item.title: How do i make the server says something?
item.dc:creator: @m.dog311 m.dog311
item.description:
@m.dog311 wrote:

In the login stuff (where the login messages are sent) add this.

int wintergreenTimedSendMessage == 1; int winterGreenTimedSendMessage2 == 1; // How many seconds you want between sends. for ( ; ; ) { if (wintergreenTimedSendMessage == winterGreenTimedSendMessage*1000) { sendMessage("Hi"); // Change hi to what you want sent winterGreenTimedSendMessage == 1; } else { winterGreenTimedSendMessage++; }

Read full topic
item.source: How do i make the server says something?

item.title: How do i make the server says something?
item.dc:creator: @Brenz Brenz
item.description:
@Brenz wrote:

Ive taken a look on the web and so far ive come up with something like this:

for ( i=1; i<60000; i++; q="Message" ) { 
    sendMessage(q);
    sleep(60000);
}

Basically what it could do if it was corrected is:

i=1, if i is less than 60000 add i (1)

Then q is the message, sendMessage sends the message to the server (I think)

Then it sleeps for however many milliseconds

Then repeats

Im new to coding so if this is anywhere near right it will probs have some mistakes in it, if u see em plz post and ill fix.

Brendan

Read full topic
